data.title: Ed Gonzalez: Top 10s
data.meta_description: Slant's film editor ranks his favorite films from the silent era to the present.
data.text:
This Top 10 project began as a rolling engagement on Slant Magazine’s blog in late 2005. Now the lists are collected here. All films prior to 2001—the year I started ranking films on Slant based on their U.S. theatrical release dates—go by their IMDB year. Titles in my Honorable Mention sections have been limited to 10, and the titles listed under Blind Spots are just that: films that have eluded me over the years for whatever reason. This latter section exists, without embarrassment, for two reasons: perspective (for you) and incentive (for me). The latest 20 films I’ve seen, not including any titles scheduled to be released during the current calendar year, are listed below. Any titles bumped from the Honorable Mention section to make room for a film, or any titles that are no longer “blind” but fail to make the list for their respective year, will disappear from this page without fanfare. You can follow my occasional ramblings on my Twitter feed. If you find errors on this page, feel free to shoot me a tweet, email me at [email protected], or make a comment below, where you can also shoot the shit.

Latest Seen: Benedetta (Paul Verhoeven, 2021), A Shape of Things to Come (J.P. Sniadecki and Lisa Malloy, 2020), No Time to Die (Cary Joji Fukunaga, 2021), The Eyes of Tammy Faye (Michael Showalter, 2021), Memory House (João Paulo Miranda Maria, 2020), The Fever (Maya Da-Rin, 2019), Procession (Robert Greene, 2021), Parallel Mothers (Pedro Almodóvar, 2021), Spencer (Pablo Larraín, 2021), Passing (Rebecca Hall, 2021), Funny Face (Tim Sutton, 2020), Lamb (Valdimar Jóhannsson, 2021), Mass (Fran Kranz, 2021), The Beta Test (Jim Cummings and PJ McCabe, 2021), Wrath of Man (Guy Ritchie, 2021), Titane (Julia Ducournau, 2021), Dune (Denis Villeneuve, 2021), The Two Sights (Joshua Bonnetta, 2020), Halloween Kills (David Gordon Green, 2021), Siberia (Abel Ferrara, 2020)
